body_html:
I am inclined to reject the changes in install_pip_packages.sh file.
First, that file is for our continuous integration system, and end users should not be using/depending on it.
Second, in our CI I would like all our dependencies to be tightly controlled.
For example, your changes will cause numpy to be upgraded to 1.13, which causes a lot of test failures due to a bug in the new numpy version. Without a version lock on numpy version, our CI will start breaking and debugging such issues would be very difficult.

For the changes to setup.py, I think that is a tensorboard dependency.
Please send a pull request with this change to our brand new tensorboard repository for discussion.

For the changes to setup.py, I think that is a tensorboard dependency.
Please send a pull request with this change to our brand new tensorboard repository for discussion.
body:
I am inclined to reject the changes in install_pip_packages.sh file.
First, that file is for our continuous integration system, and end users should not be using/depending on it.
Second, in our CI I would like all our dependencies to be tightly controlled.
For example, your changes will cause numpy to be upgraded to 1.13, which causes a lot of test failures due to a bug in the new numpy version. Without a version lock on numpy version, our CI will start breaking and debugging such issues would be very difficult.

For the changes to setup.py, I think that is a tensorboard dependency.
Please send a pull request with this change to our brand new tensorboard repository for discussion.
